values:
I don't believe in fate, but I am an avid fan of serendipity.  I recently met a cute boy that is triggering so many "what the fuck?!"s, in a very very very good way.

The fuck I'm squeeing about most is the fact that last night he brought up Adventure Games, being like, "Ok, QfG4- best of the series, or best of the series?"  Which of course gave me Melissa-boners.  We end up having a long conversation about Adventure games (ahh, the nerd mating dance!).  Finally, I ask him if he's played my favorite indie adventure game.  I am omitting the name for privacy reasons.  But he went: "... what?  That's my name."

Yes, the boy I have been flirting with has the same name as my favorite adventure game protagonist.

Mind. Blown.
Yes yes yes, I want to play a game in this setting!!

I know I'm interested in something long-term and meaningful romance-wise.  But when that's not available, and something cute, young, and fun is, do I jump on that? Do I distract myself with a short term fling, or wait for something that seems real?

I'm terrible at patience. But I'm tired of only smuggling with my cat at night, and I'd prefer to get paddled by someone less furry & demonic.

Last night I went to a fabulous concert of Molly Lewis and The Doubleclicks.  It was amazing!  It was a bit awkward, because we were sitting in the front row, which meant I could have reached my hand out and caressed them.  I did not.  But I WANTED TO.  Oh man, those girls were hot.  My friends , and joined me, and then after we went to Packards.  Lousy waitress, until I found out it was her birthday, and she was the only waitress on duty and had to cover all the tables.  Poor girl.

There was this girl at the show which I checked out, super cute, nerdy glasses, short blond hair, similar figure to me except slightly smaller and more muscular.  And fantastic tattoos!  She had a chaos star on her arm.  She caught me checking her out... and I lesbian sheeped.  If ever there was a time to go talk to a cute girl!  But no, I didn't.  Hell, I didn't even tell my friends about noticing her until after we were gone and they couldn't embarrass me.

But now I have this stuck in my head:

At my wit's end with this cat.  She has decided she likes severing wires now.  She's never chewed them before.  On her first try she severed my speaker wire, and now my brand new headset.

I have no idea how to deal with this cat.  I know this is a normal cat thing, but... Do I not allow her in my room?  Disciplining her does not work in the slightest.  She's not afraid of me, and when I pull out the spray bottle she often gets hostile and attacks me.

I find myself having feelings towards those people who are not interested in me, and being bored by those people who want me.  While I think mostly it's that those people who are pursuing me just aren't right for me, I wonder.  Am I self sabotaging?  I'm slowly remembering how angsty I was as a teen and early 20's, pining away for those who were oblivious.  There's a reason I got a rep as a creeper.  And honestly, I do NOT want to go back there. 

What is it that's so attractive about a potential partner that is a bad idea?  In the bright light of day, it's easier to use logic, and rationally explain to self, "No, no no no no!" for X, Y, and Z reasons.  But in the dark, in bed, alone, half asleep reaching out to the other side of the bed, the mind won't wander to the people you might *actually* have a chance of kissing. 

Good thing Viviane loves to snuggle.

Day One: Ten things you want to say to ten different people right now.
Day Two: Nine things about yourself.
Day Three: Eight ways to win your heart.
Day Four: Seven things that cross your mind a lot.
Day Five: Six things you wish you’d never done.
Day Six: Five people who mean a lot (in no order whatsoever)
Day Seven: Four turn-offs.
Day Eight: Three turn-ons.
Day Nine: Two images that describe your life right now, and why.
Day Ten: One confession

Day Four: Seven things that cross your mind a lot.

1)  "I really really really need to clean."

2)  "Oh many, this would be a really great idea for this game."

3)  "I will never ever be approved for a business loan, unless... <insert wacky harebrained scheme here>"

4) <Random inappropriate sexual fantasy>

5)  "I wish dragons really existed."

6)  "What can I make for food that I can put cheese on?"

7) "Ugh, why is writing so hard?!"

Day One: Ten things you want to say to ten different people right now.
Day Two: Nine things about yourself.
Day Three: Eight ways to win your heart.
Day Four: Seven things that cross your mind a lot.
Day Five: Six things you wish you’d never done.
Day Six: Five people who mean a lot (in no order whatsoever)
Day Seven: Four turn-offs.
Day Eight: Three turn-ons.
Day Nine: Two images that describe your life right now, and why.
Day Ten: One confession

Day Three: Eight ways to win your heart.

1)  Tell me about the things that make you a huge nerd.

2)  Be musically talented, especially in the earthy crunchy folk style.

3)  Make me laugh.

4)  Be good with animals.

5)  Be a charismatic, impassioned speaker.

6)  Come up to me from behind, gently touch the sides of my arms, and kiss the nape of my neck.

7) Tell me about the things that make you vulnerable.

8)  Tell me how much you care about me.

I like being able to write without feeling like I should censor myself.  I don't want to worry about the actually creepy people.  I never thought things would come to this, but from now on...











Please feel free to comment here to request to be added as a friend.

Whabam!  Life has blown up all in my face!  I am highly stressed out right now, to say the least.  The play that I'm working on currently, Raised in Captivity, is hitting some pitfalls.

1) We have yet to rehearse in the space we are performing in.  We are now less than 2 weeks from tech week, and neither the actors NOR THE DESIGNERS have gotten to work in the space really.  Luckily, we're working from a rep plot and have a  minimalist set, but this is getting a bit ridiculous.  It's hard to stage things in a room 2/3 the size of the actual stage.

2) Our props mistress and dramaturg both dropped out 2 weeks before tech week.  WHAT THE FUCK??!?!?  While props had a significant job, the dramaturg had 1 fucking job to do, and decides 2 MONTHS IN that she can't do it.  Dumb fucking cunt!  Seriously, all she had to do was schedule a panel discussion for one of the performances, and she had 3 months to do it in, and 3 weeks before the performance she says she doesn't have enough time.  Same thing with props- we've needed these props all along, and now she says that she doesn't have enough time to go and buy them, but she's sure Michael and I will have the time to go get them.  Riiiiight, cause we're in rehearsal 20 hours a week, and the Director and the Stage Manager don't have other shit to do, nope...  So now Michael, the director, has taken on the panel discussion responsibility, and I'm both SM and props mistress.  Great!

3)  Scheduling blows donkey balls.  The Production Manager (a professor in the department) has yet to get back to us on rehearsal space.  Our actors have scheduling conflicts out the wazoo, some of which being a grandfather's wake and funeral, a sister's wedding, other performance dates, and trapeze classes.  >.<  Some of these can't be helped (family death being the main example), but it's still frustrating to have to cancel rehearsals and slowly get behind when we're already crunched for time.

So right now I desperately need some time to get to Walmart and Joanne Fabrics.  I'm going to try to take the bus there Thursday night, that's the only day I have a night off.  Anyone who wants to come with me and help me keep my sanity is more than welcome.  Also, coming to visit in the afternoons for Tea is highly encouraged.

So thanks for listening to me vent.  I'm still kinda twitchy though.  

<hr>

Oh, and also, Cute Girl has IMed me a few times over the weekend, and is all like, "So am I going to see you again?"  So that's also now in the back of my mind, because I really like her personality.  And, as my friends have pointed out, "She has really great boobies."  (That is a direct quote from Girl's Night last Saturday).  The thing is, with all this shit going on, I just don't have the energy to play a cat and mouse game with her.  I would love to see her again, but I don't know if I can be suave.  Cause, you know, I'm sooooo suave with the ladies...



Ok, DRAMAZZ is over.  For now.

This weekend was fun.  I had Vampire: The Requiem LARP on Saturday night.  My character there is Madame Belinda O'Connell, a Daeva Invictus socialite that is already sleeping with the Consul!  I am a "valea", one who sleeps their way to the top.  Woo!  My character looks like Kim Catrall, and I get to dress skanky for each game.  It's fun.  Right now in game I'm working on a Masquerade Ball that is being hosted by my clan.  I already have the dress I'm going to wear, I just need to make a mask.  If anyone in the area wants to go to a craft store with me to buy masking materials, give me a call!  *Looks at Sarah, Ian, and Crystal specifically*  I also want to get a flower to wear next game.  And give a flower to my date at the Ball, one that means something evil.... *muah hahahhaha!*  I love geekery!

One thing I wonder is if everyone in game thinks I'm just like my character.  I mean, I don't really talk to many of them outside of the game - to be honest I don't know most of their actual names!  But I would like people to know that I'm not a stuffy sex-crazed elitist whore in real life.  Ah well, c'est la vie.  


Anywho, on Sunday, Joe's family was supposed to come out for lunch, but due to his dad's friend's recent death they could not make it.  So Joe and I went to Northampton ourselves for the afternoon.  We went to Sparky's American Food and had burgers, which were AWFUL.  They were overpriced, because they were organic free range meats, and they were cooked badly and in small portions.  Perhaps their hot dogs are good, but so far I give them two thumbs down.  Then we walked around, attempting to window shop, but nearly everything was closed due to Zombie Bunny Jesus Day.  Ah well.

This week is full of rehearsals and play things.  Perhaps more updates later, perhaps not.

So my computer is caput.  Well, sort of. 
<lj-cut text="Problem behind cut.  ">It started by locking up a few times for no reason. Then, when I rebooted one time, it didn't connect to the internet. After some searching, I discovered in the device manager an error "Code 12" - "There are not enough free resources to run this device." on both my wireless card and my regular network card. Since then, I have:
 
 Uninstalled and reinstalled the drivers (did nothing)
 Checked which resources their supposedly sharing (Error, doesn't list which resouces it's using)
 Disabled one at a time (did nothing)
 Loaded to my last known good config (did nothing)
 Full System restore to a few days before (error message, stopped keyboard from working)
 Uninstalled my keyboard drivers and reinstalled (fixed keyboard)
 Downloaded new drivers from Dell, and reinstalled (did nothing)
 Flashed the BIOS to updated version (Dell update is broken, tho they won't admit it, but it lists that on their website)
 Flashed BIOS to Previous version (Error: Not enough memory to complete, reboot and try again? Nope, still not enough memory)
 Flashed BIOS with current version (Same error as previous)
 Listened to tech support go "...whoa.  huh." at least 15 times
 Deleted the partition from my harddrive, reformatted, and reinstalled XP (action completed, problem still there)
 Uninstalled and reinstalled updated drivers (did nothing)
 Tried Flashing BIOS again (same errors as before)
 Banged head on desk repeatedly.
 
 
 
 Next step: wait for Dell technician to come and replace the two network cards/adaptors.
 
 My laptop is under full warranty, even if I took a hammer to it, so no worries there. It's just frustrating, because out of the 6 people I've talked to for tech support, 2 have helped me. Those 2 have been my roommate, and my dad. Dell tech support are idiots. Also, all of the ones on the hardware like are French.</lj-cut>


So anywho, yeah...  I've been using the school computers for basic email type stuff.  Argh.  

Life To-Do List:

-  Find a 4 br apartment for Joe, Ian, Dan, and myself, in the Amherst/Noho area, that is less that $450 a month per person including utilities.

-  Keep working on play, even though lead actress just dropped out because it was too stressful for her.

-  Figure out what's going on with cute girl that I like so much, but who never calls and has blown me off 2x now.  Perhaps give up.

-  Replace my student ID that I lost months ago.

This afternoon I'm going to the Mart that sells Wal, to buy fabric and an 8in crescent wrench.  Huzzah!  Please call me if you'd like to join in.  Then this evening I will be hanging out with Joe, Sarahtron, and the Splendiferous Blake!  More Huzzah!

And now they're kicking me out of the room I'm in.  Argh.

Crush this person!
Get your own ThisCrush.com CrushTag! I am so lame. Eh well, you prolly know this already.

Perhaps I should update this place, eh?

So today is a busy day for me.  I have a show at 2 (call is at noon), my parents are coming in a half hour to visit, then I'm seeing Joe in the afternoon, and then going to the Vampire LARP at Smith in the evening, then hopefully Jess is going to come back here after to visiit.  <strong bad voiceover> Holy Crap! </strong bad>  Nicely enough, Crystal responded to my plea for a ride to LARP, so I don't have to navigate the heinous bus system.  Boo for busses every hour and 10 min on Weekends!

I stumbled across this personality quiz-ish again today.  I still think it's interesting.


Ok, time to shower before the rents get here.  Maybe I'll post again soon!

I have ethics class in a few minutes, and I'm killing time while drinking coffee.  Last night I went out with my friend Brian, who I hadn't seen in a really long time.  It was really nice to catch up with him.  We hadn't really talked since Craig and I broke up, so a lot had changed since then, obviously.

I've been so friggin social this semester.  I was in my room last night, and I realized that I'm generally at my house for maybe 10 hours a day at most, usually 7 spent sleeping.  I'm either in the car, at school, or at Joe's.  It's ridiculous!  But I like it.  I've never liked just staying at home, and for once I don't have to.  It's kinda scary though, I have a spare toothbrush at Joe's house, and he's constantly finding clothing, makeup, and other stuff I just leave at his house by accident.

I hang out with my friend Steph a lot too, which is awesome.  It's great to have a female friend that I can talk about boys, girls, sex, folk singers, environmental activism, and well... everything with!  We often do lunch on Tues/Thurs, and go to crunchy places like Big Fresh or Panera.  I wonder if we'll do something today.

Eep, few minutes wasted, time to go learn about Existencialism.  Ahh Sartre, you follow me wherever I go...

Day 1 of Going to School with Mom: Disaster. See, because my car is defunct and I haven't been able to get a real job to afford one since my back went out, the plan for this semester is to drive with my mom to her job at Framingham State and then head to Massbay, since I don't have to be there till 9. Then I leave school around 4 to pick her up and go home. Seems simple enough, yes? Cept for the fact that my mom doesn't drive in snow. She hates the snow. And she's a friggin paranoid nervous driver, she won't drive at night, in bad rain, or any winter weather really. So this morning consisted of her staying in her pjs staring at the TV weather reports saying, "... maybe I'll go in later..." Seeing as my classes are at 10 and 11, it kinda made a difference how late she was going to try! But she saw a plow go by our street, and we had already shoveled and heated up the car (we had had 2 previous fake-outs of "I think I might go..."), so she's just like, "Ok, we're going!" So we head out down our street which is only half plowed, but it's a tiny side road so that's expected. We get to the end of the street, and my mom's looking at the main road and the stream of cars on it which are all going slow, and she starts to freak out a bit. She turns onto it, and we don't even go 50 feet before she goes, "AH! They haven't plowed or sanded, we're turning around!!" So we turn around after going less than a quarter of a mile, (even though they had plowed and sanded though it needed to be again). As we turn around, we see 4 cars behind us is a plow and a sander. >,< So the road was rapidly becoming clear. We still head home. Now my mom is still fretting in front of the TV. Worst part is, it's not like I can just take the car and go myself. She's still "planning on going sometime later... but much too late for you to go." Argh!! So there goes the first day of school...

While I've already posted this on myspace, I'm all about redundancy. So tonight, Friday, I'm trying to get a group of kids to go out dancing. The club would be Hell in Providence, which has "Rock and Roll High School" on Friday nights. It's supposed to be a really good time; casual dress, rock, punk, and 80's music, cheap drinks. Also, if we go before 11, no cover with "the flyer", which you can print out from online here. If you would like to go, are in the Medway area, and want to carpool, please send me a message here, on AIM at nynaevesangreal, or give my cell a call (508-254-2756). Let me know if you're willing to drive or need a ride. Even if you're not in the Medway area, you should meet us there! So far like 6 or 7 of my friends from here want to go. Good times could be had!* Huzzah! Oh, and I already posted this on myspace, but I'm all about redundancy.
*Good times are not guaranteed. Price and participation may vary. See dealership for details. The only way you can have a good time is if you actually go, so get off your ass and come dance, dammit.

I'm in a wicked good mood.  I can't wait for <lj user="jddyslexia">'s New Year's Eve Extravaganza tomorrow night.  I'm feeling soooo much better, cause that infection I had is gone, I was rather worried about it.  Yay for medications that work!  I also bought very sexy thigh high stockings and garters today, but I don't know if I'm going to wear them tomorrow.  I might save them for a special occasion where I can just stay in the bedroom all day.  ^.^

So my new boyfriend Joe and my best friend Meaghan are both coming with me.  I convinced my parents to let me take the car, because Punk Rock Dan offered to let me park at his house.  Yay!  I prolly don't even have to park at his house, but it just gives them peace of mind.  Unfortunately, before I can leave tomorrow I have to finish completely cleaning my room.  >.<  It must be done though.  C'est la vie.  I already have gotten a good start on it.  I just have so much... STUFF!!  I have more books than fit on my bookshelf, piles of paperwork to be filed, 2 months worth of clothing, and just random junk.  I've already come up with a huge bag of trash and of recycling, but I haven't even started tackling my desk yet.  Eeep!

So tonight is a night of laundry, cleaning, and blasting loud bouncy music.  Huzzah!

<hr>

And to all my UMD friends who read this, I can't wait to see you tomorrow!!  I hope you'll be there!

So the boy I went swoony over and I are dating now.  His name is Joe, and is remarkably cute.  ^.^  We started officially dating last night, Solstice.  I thought it was appropriate, cause it was symbolic of the mission I have to renew my life and start leading it the way I want, without compromise.  Knowing it's ok to get in touch with my spirituality, my inner geek, my kinkiness, and my vulnerablitiy is wonderful.  Having someone who appreciates those things is also wonderful.

But enough of the sap.  Semester is almost over, and I'm stoked.  I have a month off, and no job, and nothing to do!  It sounds like tons of fun... but I really need a job.  I'm not sure what to look for.  Since I'm not supposed to life anything, I'm a little confused as to where I should look.  I'm looking for evenings and weekends, and waitressing would be perfect for that, but since I'm not supposed to lift... *sigh*  If anyone has any ideas of job prospects, feel free to send them my way.

I really want to go to <lj user="jddyslexia">'s New Year's party, but my mother recently informed me that New Bedford is a scary place and so she doesn't want her car to stay there overnight.  Since I can't afford to replace my car right now, I can't really rail against her rules...  If anyone's willing to give me a ride from Medway for New Years to New Bedford, I'd love you forever...
This reminded me of postsecret.com, so Please post anonymously with... ... one complement ... one criticism ... one secret

this is so accurate, it actually almost makes me uncomfortable:

The Keys to Your Heart

You are attracted to those who are unbridled, untrammeled, and free.
In love, you feel the most alive when everything is uncertain, one moment heaven... the next moment hell.
You'd like to your lover to think you are flexible and ready for anything!
You would be forced to break up with someone who was insecure and in constant need of reassurance.
Your ideal relationship is traditional. Without saying anything, both of you communicate with your hearts.
Your risk of cheating is zero. You care about society and morality. You would never break a commitment.
You think of marriage as something precious. You'll treasure marriage and treat it as sacred.
In this moment, you think of love as something you can get or discard anytime. You're feeling self centered.
What Are The Keys To Your Heart?
On a brighter note, I'm really looking forward to going to the Masquerade 20ct party tomorrow! *Squee!* Joe had said I could bring friends, so my pet Jeremy, his best friend Rafi, and my friend Lauren have latched themselves onto me, and are coming along. I hope it's not too many people. :-/ If Joe or Kim see this, and it is, just let me know! I'll be showing up later tomorrow night, prolly by 10ish. But I can't wait to see people! <3

So this week I was uber busy, and it was awesome. Monday- Went home sick from work, but wasn't really sick. Just didn't want to work. ^.^ Monday night I drove to Needham to hang out with my friend Jeremy. He just gave me his address and I mapquested it... so after an hour of driving back and forth past his street because the street sign was missing, I finally got to his house. He laughed at me for getting lost. Jerk! We had fun though, talked about astrology and science fiction and taking over the world. I stayed till 1:30 watching Aqua Teen Hunger Force and looking at funny internet things. ^.^ Tuesday- Went and had dinner with Marco and watched a little bit of anime, then we went un-bowling with a group of kids from high school. The bowling lanes neglected to tell us when we called that it was league night, and they had no lanes open. >.< So we all went to Friendly's and had food and ice cream, and 8 of us crammed around a 6 person table. Hilarity ensued. Wednesday- I drove out to South Boston/Dorchester to visit the most fabulous, stylish, and awesome . We went to Diesel Cafe and caught up on each others lives and had coffee and such. Then we attempted to go to the All Asia where they were supposed to be spinning alternative music, but it was more... empty. There were maybe 5 people there. So we left and went back to his place. Ooh la la! Hehe, we stayed up late and talked, I love that kid! Thursday- I found myself traveling west, to go kidnap the lovely for lunch. Rather, we went to Applebee's for lunch, I did not in fact eat her. We had a wicked fun time, and went and raided Barnes and Noble. I've decided I must kidnap her on a regular basis now. ^.^ Thursday night I was supposed to hang out with Jeremy again, but he canceled, just because he has an unknown dehabilitating illness (I think it's mono). Psh, what was he thinking? Anywho, I ended up hanging out with Lauren and Brian, and we watched The Girl Next Door. Of all the angsty teen movies I've had to sit through, this was one of the worst. >.< But hanging out with them was wicked fun anyways. Friday- Worked. blargh. and now... cleaning until my aunt arrives... and then... being a loser and hanging out online. lol But overall, awesome week!

I've been trying to keep myself busy, and it's been working. Yesterday sucked though: I had a childrens play, where I had never seen the whole thing, and we never did a tech run. Some of the sets were improvised that day. I am the stage manager... and the only crew member. 2 acts, 7 scenes each, each a major scene change. >.< Only one thing possible could have made it worse, and it did. I was sick. By the time of the end of the show, I was pouring sweat, and had trouble standing. I made it home (a 45 min drive due to traffic) and literally passed out after taking some cold medicine. Luckily, when I woke up 5 hours later, I felt alot better, and had dinner. Anywho, my plans for the upcoming week; Monday (Tonight)- Hanging out with my friend Jeremy from Massbay. We are watching Dune and looking at astrological charts. Yay! Tuesday- I would like to get in touch with my friend , to possibly hang out with the awesomeness that is her. If you're reading this, IM me: nynaevesangreal! Wednesday- Hanging out with a wicked cool kid I haven't seen in forever, I'm so excited. I'm going to visit Doug in the big scary city, and we are perhaps going to Diesel Cafe and then going dancing. Whee! Thursday- __________________ (this means no plans as of yet) Friday- Work! >,< Saturday & Sunday- the goddamn play again. Now, it's time to go to work, ugh.
P.S. I created a new layout and icon on my spare time, snowed in on Saturday. I love BSG. ^,^
I don't know how to say this without seeming shallow or trite.  I broke up with craig tonight.  No, I am not ok, but yes, I will be.  No, it was not mutual.  But it is for the best.

H. Lawrence #40 Brave New World by Aldous Huxley #41 Sister Carrie by Theodore Dreiser #42 Gone with the Wind by Margaret Mitchell #43 Jungle by Upton Sinclair #44 All Quiet on the Western Front by Erich Maria Remarque #45 Communist Manifesto by Karl Marx #46 Lord of the Flies by William Golding #47 Diary by Samuel Pepys #48 Sun Also Rises by Ernest Hemingway #49 Jude the Obscure by Thomas Hardy #50 Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury #51 Doctor Zhivago by Boris Pasternak #52 Critique of Pure Reason by Immanuel Kant #53 One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest by Ken Kesey #54 Praise of Folly by Desiderius Erasmus #55 Catch-22 by Joseph Heller #56 Autobiography of Malcolm X by Malcolm X #57 Color Purple by Alice Walker #59 Essay Concerning Human Understanding by John Locke #60 Bluest Eye by Toni Morrison #61 Moll Flanders by Daniel Defoe #62 One Day in the Life of Ivan Denisovich by Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn #63 East of Eden by John Steinbeck #64 Invisible Man by Ralph Ellison #65 I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings by Maya Angelou #66 Confessions by Jean Jacques Rousseau #67 Gargantua and Pantagruel by Francois Rabelais #68 Leviathan by Thomas Hobbes #69 The Talmud #70 Social Contract by Jean Jacques Rousseau #71 Bridge to Terabithia by Katherine Paterson #72 Women in Love by D. This summer I have a new booklist!

Ahh the day of estrogen. I will not even start with my feelings of the ridiculousness of this day. I'll just give some highlights of what actually happened. - Craig brought me a dozen red roses at work. *cue the "awwww"s* It was really sweet. Cept for the fact that I've told him a million times that I don't really like roses, and if he does get me roses not red ones, but really I prefer irises or other flowers. Bah. hehe, he meant well, and I love him, so that's all that matters. - During my lunch break, I went out and quick got him something (guilt for not remember to do something). I got him a card and a big stuffed doggy. I left them in his car, so he'd see them before he left for work. He came into the bank right before he had to leave, and told me the story of his finding them: Apparently, he didn't notice the larged stuffed animal in his car till he opened the door. He looked and thought "Cujo!" and jumped a foot back. Onto a piece of black ice. Whereupon he pulled a Home Alone-esque fall, flat onto his back. He immediately jumped up, believing a dog was about to kill him. Was it wrong for me to laugh hysterically when I heard that? ^,^ Anyway, he was fine, and he thought it was also funny. Whee!
Again, TOMORROW I desire to go dancing of the 80s persuasion, at the Club Hell. Anyone who wants to can come along. (Roger? I'm not much company you'll find. Behave! He'll catch up later, he's just got other things on his mind)

I hung out with Danielle, a friend from work, tonight.  She brought her neighbor, who was only 14, along, because she had promised the girl she'd hang out.  We went for coffee at Meldiva's, and then went to Barne's and Nobles, then to Blockbuster.  Ahh, the plentiful ways to amuse oneself in suburbia.

I've noticed that I'm becoming really obsessive about my research into Christianity and the like.  I'm not sure if I'm just subconciously trying to assert my intelligence because of my feelings of inferiority, or if it's because I really have nothing else to talk about.  Maybe a bit of both?  In either case, there are a billion books at Barnes and Noble that I want!!!  

<hr>
Tuesday I might go to 80s night.  My friend Danielle might come with.  People who like 80s dancyness or just want to see me again should come too.  Let me know if you want to.  <3

So Craig's going to Maine this weekend with "the guys", leaving me all by my lonesome.  It made me realize I have absolutely nothing to do, other than schoolwork and cleaning.  I have no friends!!  (near here)  And driving down to UMD area is too long a drive, it makes me sleepy.  So I guess reading it is.

I've come to realize how much of a geek I really am.  I absolutely cannot wait to start working on a graduate thesis.    I really really want to be a professor, whether in Theater or English or Religion, I don't know.  Maybe all 3?  I swear though, Gen will not be the only one with a PhD in the family!
Maybe I should focus on my BA first though.  ;-)
<hr>

If anyone does want to hang out or get a cup of coffee tonight or tomorrow night, give me a call:
508-254-2756

Here's the Meme of the week:

1. Reply with your name and I will write something about you.

2. I will then tell what song(s) remind me of you.

3. Next, I will tell you who you remind me of (celebrity/animated or otherwise).

4. Last, I will try to name a single word that best describes you.

5. Put this in your journal

So, here's the usual infrequent update. I *LOVE* school. I'm such a geekazoid, it's awesome. I'm taking a clusterfuck of humanities courses: History, Drawing, Anthropology, Religion, and Communication. Woo! On my first day of Oral Communications class, the professor starts her lecture, she's a nice middle-aged Austrailian woman, and she happened to call on me, and asked me what I was majoring in, etc. I explained how I planned to major in theater with a focus in stage management and directing, and she replies, "Oh, I'm the head of the theater department here. Do you need a job? I need a stage manager for my next show. Don't worry, it's paid." To which I replies, "Buhhh, duhh, uhh..." in complete shock. She was like, "Ok, good, you're hired." A cute boy I stared at around campus all last semester is in 2 of my classes this year. He seems very cool. I want to be his friend. Not his "friend", just platonic like. He's totally my type though: tall, shaved head, wears all black in the stylish goth way (versus Hot Topicish) and a black trenchcoat, with glasses that make him look smart. Last year I played chess with him once in the cafeteria, he brings a set with him at all times I think. Also, the first day he wore a shirt that said "What Would Cthulu Do?" and was drinking coffee from a Wizards of the Coast mug. I definitely want to be his friend! I'm going to see the Producers with my sister, Wed the 23rd. I got incredibly cheap tickets through school, $15 for front row balcony seats, towards the center on an aisle!!!! Normally it's over $80 for tix like that. I'm incredibly stoked, and I'm just hoping I don't get murdered by my fellow theater aficionado friends. And Craig. I didn't invite him, cause I know he's not a huge musical fan... but I forgot that he loves Mel Brooks. Eep. He couldn't have gone anyway, he's working, but he's still pissed. Oh well, c'est la vie. Our 1 year anniversary is the 15th. I'm not an anniversary kinda person, and seeing as we had been having sex for months before that as "friends", people ask why we bother, and have a specific date. (My Mom asked. *sigh*) To this I replied that it's the first time we told each other we loved each other, and for that it's special. So in conclusion, I am a huge giant smushy monster of girly hormonic danger.
P.S. I miss seeing EVERYONE.

I didn't make any resolutions for this year.  I'm not entirely sure why not, I guess I just already have so many goals in my head, I didn't need to add any because of a date a Roman picked years ago.  But if I did make resolutions here's what they would be:

-Lose weight, about 35 - 40 lbs.  Also, get in shape, both core stomach muscles, and arm muscles.  (these are all for medical reasons, mandated by my doctor, for those of you who try to be nice and say "oh, you're fine!", cause I'm not)

-Fill out all summer theater and college applications by the end of February at the latest.  

-Figure out a way of organizing my room that I can live with and maintain.

-Have a huge kickass 21st birthday, where I really do something extravagent. (June 16th people, only 152 days away!)

I think that's about it.

<hr>

P.S.  I'm considering a new major.  Not as a replacement, but a double major.  Anthropology or Myth.  We'll see how that goes.

Craig and I un-broke up!  WOOOO!!


here's to a new beginning.

Craig and I broke up.

the end.

To retreat from the emo-ness that is my attitude toward life, we will have a common meme.


Ask me something you don't know about me. It doesn't have to be something that should be obvious, ask me something really bizzare if you so desire.  I will be completely honest and candid as a lemur on fridays with toast.

When I'm not with him, all I can think about is not being with him, and how much better that would be.

But as soon as I see him, or talk to him, I can't imagine losing him, can't imagine not talking to him everyday, not being with him.

I know he deserves better from a relationship than what I can give him.  Trying to convince him of that is another story.  

I know our paths are diverging, but I don't know where I'm heading...

<hr>

P.S. I think I have the beginnings of strep.
check out Sorry Everybody. I'm sorry too. All my arty friends, I hope you might contribute to this, I know I'm going to. <3

What's a girl like you doing in a place like this when there's a Farscape marathon on right now on the Sci Fi channel? I <3 Nerds. At least that's what my t-shirt says anyways. ^_^ (it' like this only grey, with a pink heart.)

my mind seems to be racing at a million miles an hour lately. I have so much that needs to get done, but it's so hard to get over the little speedbumps, let alone start tackling the mountains I've built up. It's amazing how your emotional relationship can make or break the other aspects of your life. It's times like these where I totally bond with my Ani Difranco Cds. And yes, I know how cliche, wanna-be feminist, indie-arty girl it is. I can't help it though. Alot of what she says just hits me. I crave change. I want to dance, to revel, to be happy and spending energy, I'm tired of relaxing, tired of not struggling. To me, happiness comes after you've accomplished something. Maybe that's the biproduct of growing up in a Puritan society with it's values on work ethics, but regardless, I've been feeling like... I'm not living up to my potential. So many things are holding me back, but at the same time the only thing holding me back is me, and the obstacles I've put in my way. I feel really friggin old. I feel old, and I'm 20. I always used to feel like the young one, the immature one, always trying to act older. Now I just feel old, I've actually succeeded in advancing time like I've always tried to. I used to laugh at everything, I was lighthearted, I never stopped joking. Now people tell me to stop being so serious, to lighten up. I want to blame it on Craig, but it's me. I know I need to change, that I'm the one who's stagnating. What I don't know is if he can be with me while I change, or if it would be better for me to be alone. I don't know what's fair, or what's right, or what's real. what kind of paradise am i looking for? i've got everything i want and still i want more I miss art. I miss theater. I miss new music. I miss philosophical debates with friends over nonsense hypothetical situations. I miss photography. I miss writing poetry. I miss going to coffee shops alone and just sitting, people watching, listening to angsty girl music, and just contemplating. I miss getting in touch with my spiritual side. I miss exercising on a regular basis. I miss that feeling of anticipation and excitement when you see someone you really like being with. I miss geek talk, and being an utter nerd. I miss girl talk, but not the vapid bankgirl talk, the real women conversations. I miss being entirely alone. I miss being surrounded by friends who aren't afraid to say things that might possibly piss me off... or make me laugh. when you look at me you see my purpose, see my pride you think i just saddle up my anger and ride and ride and ride you think i stand so firm you think i sit so high on my trusty steed let me tell you i'm usually face down on the ground when there's a stampede

Craig's fine.  He has a mild concussion, CAT scan was ok, he was released in time to see most of the game.  He and I talked about things, and we're better.  He's not mad about me going to dinner, but that whole thing was a wierd circumstance.  The whole day has just been wierd.

I just really need to clear my head.

Ok kiddos, we're gonna have a simple lesson in fate:

What happens when you go out to dinner with another guy, other than your boyfriend?

Your boyfriend gets seriously hurt while fighting a fire!


Cause and effect kids, cause and effect.
